Samuel wrote:
> Beautiful, it works fine now (It is already storing on the tables with
> each of the fetched documents). Thanks for the tip. Now I must get
> stuff from the httpRecorder().getRecordedInput() with a
> RecordingInputStream right? Is this the simplest way to get the whole
> document?

You probably want to use HttpRecorder.getReplayInputStream(), to get
a stream from which you can read exactly what was 'recorded' at the
earlier fetch step. This is what the existing ARC-writing code uses.
(In contrast, getRecordedInput() will return the actual input-stream
which was used as a wrapper for the initial recording, which is unlikely
to be in a usable state for more reading.)

If you prefer a CharSequence interface (for example to perform
regex matching), you could use getReplayCharSequence() instead. Most
existing extractorinterprets the recorded data with respect to a
character-encoding, it's not the raw, byte-for-byte exact copy that
the replay-input-stream provides.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
